executive_summary: Declines in construction activity have limited demand for the faucet manufacturing industry over the past five years to 2023. Demand for faucets primarily relies on the number of new houses built, residential remodeling activity and trends in the nonresidential construction market. Industry revenue has declined and has fluctuated with construction activity. Construction markets tend to be cyclical, typically experiencing years of decline following years of growth. In addition, due to the emergence of the pandemic in 2020, activity within the nonresidential sector eroded. Also, high-interest rates issued by the Federal Reserve hindered residential construction activity, hampering industry revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand from Downstream Markets Weakened, Hindering Industry Revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The nonresidential construction sector accounts for more than half of industry revenue; faucets are installed in office buildings, hospitals, hotels, airports, government buildings, shopping malls, restaurants, sports facilities and manufacturing facilities, making the market a key source of demand. Similarly, the residential construction sector is a key downstream market for faucets since products are installed in bathrooms, kitchens and laundry rooms. Due to the high-interest rate environment, the value of residential and nonresidential construction has declined over the past five years to 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the past five years to 2023, the number of enterprises has increased. Small niche manufacturers entered the industry to satisfy the growing demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising Exports Will Aid Growth and Industry Imports Are Also Expected to Climb
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The trade-weighted index measures the value of the US dollar compared with its trading partners. The trade-weighted index is expected to decline, weakening the US dollar over the next five years. As the US dollar depreciates, domestic goods become more appealing abroad, causing export activity to grow. The value of industry exports is expected to climb over the next five years as demand from Mexico and Canada rebounds and international trade flows resume relative normalcy. Industry imports are expected to climb despite a depreciating US dollar over the next five years.

industry_definition: This industry comprises establishments primarily engaged in manufacturing metal and plastics plumbing fixture fittings and trim, such as faucets, flush valves and shower heads.
key_trends: Both regulatory and social pressures are expected to drive demand for environmentally friendly products, which typically have improved functionality and connectivity, facilitating higher selling prices. The increased capital investment costs of converting product lines to lead-free versions will cause industry profit to climb as manufacturers pass down the added costs to consumers.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Faucets have numerous customized applications in office buildings, schools, hospitals, airports, sports facilities, convention centers, shopping malls, restaurants and industrial facilities. In 2023, commercial construction is expected to account for over one-half of industry revenue. This segment has lagged as the economy was disrupted due to the coronavirus pandemic and the value of private nonresidential construction declined over the past five years.

New residential construction, including single-family homes and multifamily buildings such as apartments and condominiums, represents roughly one-quarter of US faucet demand in 2023. Over the past five years, this segment has slumped along with the value of the residential construction market and, despite an increase in housing starts, an indicator of single and multiunit residential housing. This segment has exhibited declines over the past five years as falling consumer confidence hindered the value of residential construction over the past five years.

Residential faucet replacements, renovations and repairs represent the smallest market in the industry in 2023. Over the past five years to 2023, this segment has increased as a percentage of industry revenue due to rising disposable income, consumer spending and private spending on home improvements. Changing consumer demands and legislative requirements for more water-efficient faucets are expected to possibly grow this segment over the next five years.

products_and_services.product_description: Single-lever fixture controls include metallic and nonmetallic plumbing fixture controls, two- and three-handle bath and shower fittings and anti-scald bath or shower valves.
Other fittings include disc-valve faucets, miscellaneous fixture fittings and trim such as metallic and nonmetallic faucets and brass fittings.

Non-single lever lavatory and sink fittings, which include compression valve faucets, are the most popular products in this industry. Compression valve faucets are typically double-handled and are distinguishable by their separate hot and cold-water handles and their action requiring users to tighten handles to shut off water flow.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: LAVATORY AND SILK FITTINGS, NONSINGLE-LEVER SEGMENT
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Non-single lever lavatory and sink fittings, which include compression valve faucets, are the most popular products in this industry. Compression valve faucets are typically double-handled and are distinguishable by their separate hot and cold-water handles and their action requiring users to tighten handles to shut off water flow. They work by using a compression stem, a screw with a washer on the end that presses against a valve seat to shut off water flow. These products typically are less costly than competing products but more prone to leaks and maintenance.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: THE SINGLE-LEVER FIXTURE CONTROLS SEGMENT DECLINES BECAUSE OF LESS DEMAND FOR RESIDENTIAL AND NONRESIDENTIAL CONSTRUCTION
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Single-lever fixture controls include metallic and nonmetallic plumbing fixture controls, two- and three-handle bath and shower fittings and anti-scald bath or shower valves. Single-lever lavatory and sink fittings are typically distinguishable by a single handle that moves over a rounded ball that regulates the flow and mixing temperature of the water coming from the faucet.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: OTHER FITTINGS HAVE GROWN BECAUSE THEY HAVE A HIGH PENETRATION IN UPSCALE RESIDENTIAL AND NONRESIDENTIAL APPLICATIONS
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Other fittings include disc-valve faucets, miscellaneous fixture fittings and trim such as metallic and nonmetallic faucets and brass fittings. Disc-valve faucets are the latest development in faucet technology and are identifiable by a single lever over a wide cylindrical body. They control water flow using two airtight ceramic disks that glide back and forth and are highly resistant to temperature extremes and corrosion.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Over the past five years to 2023, industry imports have slightly declined despite a strengthening US dollar. When the US dollar strengthens, imports become more affordable for domestic consumers. US domestic demand increased over the past five years, limiting declines in industry imports. In addition, household disposable income rose, helping domestic purchasing power. Most industry imports come from low-cost countries in Asia.

Industry exports have declined significantly over the past five years. A strengthening US dollar makes industry exports more expensive for foreign customers, contributing to declined exports over the past five years.

business_locations.location_description: The West accounts for the largest share of the concentration of industry establishments. California has a high concentration due to its population and proximity to Mexico, a prominent export market for US-manufactured faucets. California is also the nation's leading manufacturing state, ranking first in almost every general manufacturing category, such as the number of establishments, number of employees, total payroll, value added by manufacture, value of shipments and new capital spending. California is also the most populous state, meaning it has the largest residential and commercial real estate markets in the United States and is the largest domestic market for products.
The Great Lakes region accounts for the second-largest concentration of industry establishments.

The Southeast region accounts for the third-largest concentration of industry establishments. The Southeast is the most populous region in the United States and is a national leader in industrial product manufacturing, industrial organic chemicals and other chemical industry subsectors, which all use commercial faucets. The high percentage of establishments indicates manufacturers' desires to be near their customer base and their lower transportation costs. Housing and building activity in the region has been strong, which supports operations seeking to sell to residential markets.

FAQs.question: How did the COVID-19 pandemic impact the industry?
FAQs.answer: In March 2020, the COVID-19 pandemic began to strongly impair the United States. As infection rates and deaths increased, state governments implemented strict policies regarding citizen movement and business operations to combat the virus.

FAQs.question: What assistance was provided to the industry?
FAQs.answer: The text mentions 'moderate assistance' and 'steady assistance' being provided to the industry, but does not give any specifics.

FAQs.question: What are the tariff rates for imported faucet products?
FAQs.answer: Most faucet products imported into the United States incur a normal trade relations (NTR) duty of 2.0% to 5.6%.

FAQs.question: What is the role of the National Fluid Power Association (NFPA)?
FAQs.answer: The National Fluid Power Association (NFPA) focuses on the entire supply chain for fluid power. It supports operators by applying standards, providing legislative support, addressing legal issues, and producing market information for management decisions.
